title: Trains and postal services hit by mass strikes
description: Large parts of Britain have no train services as rail workers in several unions walk out.

title: Eurasian Beaver now legally protected in England
description: Wildlife groups praised the move making it illegal to capture, kill, injure or disturb them.

title: Cyclone Ian batters South Carolina in second US landfall
description: After wreaking deadly havoc in Florida, Ian smashes piers in South Carolina and floods neighbourhoods.

title: Sleeping in barns - homeless in the countryside
description: Rural rough sleepers face harsh conditions as a taskforce warns of a hidden homelessness "crisis".

title: Brazil voters: 'Our candidate isn't perfect, but he beats the alternative'
description: For many voters in Brazil, the election is as much about who they want to keep out as who they want in.

title: Ukraine war: Tortured for refusing to teach in Russian
description: Teachers in parts of recently-occupied Ukraine say they were beaten and forced to destroy textbooks.

title: What happened to the UK economy, pound and mortgages this week?
description: The last seven days have been a rollercoaster with mortgage costs and the pound thrown off course.

title: Roblox removes 'meat grinder' Ukraine v Russia game
description: The War on Larkiv game was accepted and promoted by the world's largest children's game platform.

title: Week in pictures: 24 - 30 September 2022
description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken in the past seven days.

title: Tax cuts pledge did cause disruption, Liz Truss says
description: The prime minister acknowledges that her economic plans "involve disruption in the short term".

title: The cyclist admitted wrongdoing in 2013
description: Lance Armstrong said he'd apologise to the man he sued for reporting on his doping

title: 'People always assume care kids are bad kids'
description: Two young people brought up in care speak about challenging stereotypes and the need for safe housing.

title: The Papers: Kwarteng's spending vow and Moors Murders search
description: The chancellor's pledge to bring in a debt-reduction plan and the police hunt for Keith Bennett's body feature.

title: Trent Alexander-Arnold: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp defends full-back after England omission
description: Jurgen Klopp says he would pick "exceptional" Trent Alexander-Arnold in any team after the full-back was overlooked by England manager Gareth Southgate.

title: Hyde Park: Soldier, 18, found dead at London barracks
description: Trooper Jack Burnell-Williams reportedly took part in the late Queen's funeral procession.

title: Rare tree dormouse not seen for 20 years found in Austria
description: Researchers hope to learn more about the species, found in a Salzburg forest, before it goes into hibernation.

title: Hull City 0-2 Luton Town: Hatters consign managerless hosts to home defeat
description: Luton Town inflict a sixth Championship defeat of the season on Hull City, who sacked manager Shota Arveladze just hours before kick-off.

title: Iran protests: 'Nine Europeans' arrested in latest unrest
description: Germany, France, the UK and Sweden have been warned over the involvement of their "agents", Iran says.

title: Ukraine war: Russia completes land-grab as Kyiv's territory annexed
description: President Putin has sparked an international outcry by annexing four regions of occupied Ukraine.

title: Aerial views of destruction from Hurricane Ian in Florida
description: Seen from above, the wreckage Hurricane Ian left in its wake shows the power of the historic storm.

title: Prince tweets on online safety after Molly inquest
description: Prince William says online safety for young people should be "prerequisite, not an afterthought" after inquest into 14-year-old's death

title: England in Pakistan: Phil Salt stars as tourists level Twenty20 series
description: Phil Salt smashes an unbeaten 88 from 41 balls as England storm to an eight-wicket win over Pakistan in the sixth T20 international.

title: Cashy C's: The musical staging working class stories in a pawnbrokers shop
description: Cashy C's, a rap musical about life on the breadline, is being performed in an empty Bradford shop.

title: Gene test spared baby unnecessary chemotherapy
description: It revealed a lump on the newborn's leg was a rare and benign mass called a myofibroma.

title: Worcester Warriors: Administrators face exodus of players after further unpaid wages
description: Worcester Warriors' administrators expect players to give two weeks' notice after not being paid their September wages.

title: Inuit Greenlanders demand answers over Danish birth control scandal
description: Denmark and Greenland agree to investigate traumatising birth control procedures on Inuit Greenlanders.

title: Phil Collins and two Genesis bandmates sell song catalogue for a reported $300m
description: The deal is one of the biggest in music history, approaching the sum paid for Bob Dylan's music.

title: Netflix's Jeffrey Dahmer drama attracts huge ratings and strong reactions
description: The latest true crime streaming show is criticised by some - but achieves huge viewing figures.

title: Black and Asian infected blood victims feel let down, inquiry told
description: Witnesses say medical staff did not believe they were infected with hepatitis C in the UK.

title: What are the sanctions on Russia and are they hurting its economy?
description: Western nations have imposed severe sanctions on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine.

title: Complaint about texts sent to female agent by Chelsea president initially dismissed
description: Chelsea's president of business initially dismissed a complaint about inappropriate text messages sent by the club's commercial director to a female agent as "not relevant" to his job.

title: The Edenfield Centre: Bereaved family 'reeling with anger' at abuse
description: A BBC investigation found a "toxic culture" of abuse and bullying at a Manchester mental health unit.

title: Olivia Pratt-Korbel: Further arrest over Liverpool shooting
description: A man is held on suspicion of assisting an offender after the killing of Olivia Pratt-Korbel.

title: Ukraine war: Putin raises stakes in speech full of anti-Western bile
description: The Russian leader's fiery speech is an attempt to divert from Russia's problems on the battlefield.

title: Steve Wright hosts his final BBC Radio 2 afternoon show
description: The DJ tells listeners he wants to "celebrate the show's success and long run" after 23 years.

title: Liz Truss resists calls for earlier tax plans assessment
description: Some Tories believe publishing the forecast sooner would reassure markets following a turbulent week.

title: Jockey Soumillon banned for elbowing rival off horse
description: Jockey Christophe Soumillon is banned for 60 days by France Galop after elbowing rival Rossa Ryan out of the saddle during a race.

title: Moors Murders: Search for Keith Bennett's body restarts
description: Police search for the body of Keith Bennett, killed in 1964, after "potential remains" are found.

title: Covid infections rise by 14% in a week in UK
description: But there is no clear evidence of an autumn wave starting, says the Office for National Statistics.

title: EU agrees windfall tax on energy firms
description: The EU has agreed to implement levies on energy firms which are benefiting from soaring gas prices.

title: BP in oil field where 'cancer is like the flu'
description: BBC investigation uncovers the deadly impact of the oil giant's toxic air pollution on children.

title: Budget cap breach is 'speculation'- Red Bull
description: Red Bull have described as "speculation" claims that they breached Formula 1's budget cap during the 2021 season.

title: The Governess, Anne Hegerty, on autism, quizzing and her challenges with everyday life
description: The Governess, Anne Hegerty, on autism and how she finds everyday household tasks difficult.

title: Social media a factor in Molly Russell death - coroner
description: Molly Russell, 14, viewed social media posts about self-harm and suicide before taking her own life.

title: Singapore Grand Prix: Lewis Hamilton fastest in Singapore first practice
description: Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton is a surprise fastest in first practice at the Singapore Grand Prix.

title: Sue Barker: 'BBC could have handled my Question of Sport exit better'
description: The presenter says the BBC could have handled her exit better when it decided to shake-up the show.

title: PnB Rock: Father and son pair charged with rapper's murder
description: The pair are accused of being behind the shooting of PnB Rock in a Los Angeles waffle house robbery.

title: Rugby League World Cup: England name Dom Young and Victor Radley in squad
description: England select uncapped NRL-based duo Dom Young and Victor Radley in their 24-man squad for the Rugby League World Cup.

title: Ex-Oasis guitarist Bonehead says tonsil cancer is 'gone'
description: Liam Gallagher is among those saying how pleased they are the musician said he is now in recovery.

title: Ukraine war: Many dead as rockets hit civilian convoy in Zaporizhzhia
description: At least 23 civilians reportedly killed as they tried to enter Russian-held territory to deliver aid.

title: Tax wealthiest 1% to fund home insulation, say Greens
description: At the party's annual conference, its co-leaders will say a new levy would raise around £70bn a year.

title: Harry Styles: Could singer's make-up get more men into cosmetics?
description: The popstar-slash-actor's beauty brand branches into cosmetics - but will other men follow his lead?

title: Ed Sheeran must face copyright trial over Thinking Out Loud, judge rules
description: The star is ordered to appear in a US court over claims he copied his hit song from Marvin Gaye.

title: Lev Tahor Jewish sect members held in Mexico escape
description: Dramatic footage shows members escaping the site where they were held since a raid on their base.

title: Football Focus: Liverpool's Harvey Elliott and Fabio Carvalho take on Honesty Cards
description: Liverpool's Harvey Elliott and Fabio Carvalho put their friendship to the test with Honesty Cards.

title: New growth figures suggest UK not in recession
description: Output grew in the second quarter of this year, data shows, despite an initial reading saying it had shrunk.

title: Norrie pulls out of Korea Open an hour before quarter-final
description: British number one Cameron Norrie pulls out of his Korea Open quarter-final against Jenson Brooksby because of illness.

title: Kabul blast: At least 19 dead after suicide attack at education centre - police
description: The blast took place at the Kaaj education centre in the Dasht-e-Barchi area in the west of the city.

title: Sports Personality of the Year Unsung Hero tell us about your local heroes
description: Nominations for the BBC Sports Personality of the Year Unsung Hero award are now open.

title: Rail strike: London Marathon runners face chaos
description: Participants are warned 90% of rail services will not run on Saturday, the day before the race.

title: Hurricane Ian: Death toll rises as storm strengthens
description: As flooding traps people in their homes, the storm is now taking aim at South Carolina.

title: Doorstep murder: Police have new man in sights over banker shooting
description: The development comes after a flurry of activity in the hunt for the killer of banker Alistair Wilson.

title: Man City v Man Utd: Erik ten Hag facing a derby dilemma - Danny Murphy analysis
description: MOTD2 pundit Danny Murphy says Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag has a big decision to make in midfield for Sunday's Manchester derby.

title: Ukraine war: Zaporizhzhia locals flee Russia annexation
description: As Moscow formally seizes more of Ukraine, the BBC speaks to those on Russia's new so-called “border”.

title: Trevor Noah to step down as host of The Daily Show
description: The comedian says he is "filled with gratitude" as he announces his departure from the programme.

title: Hurricane Ian: 'Worst thing ever in my whole life'
description: Mobile home residents without any insurance are counting the cost of a devastating storm in Florida.

title: Australia to end mandatory Covid isolation
description: After enforcing some of world's toughest rules, Australia will no longer force people to stay at home.

title: 'I worry about choosing between heat and nappies'
description: With the energy price cap set to rise, BBC News talks to Kezia, who struggles on a prepayment meter.

title: David Tennant jealous of incoming Doctor Who star Ncuti Gatwa
description: The star on returning to the sci-fi TV show, and his new stage production, Good, about the Holocaust.

title: Guide dog goodbye: Sean and Sammy share their last walk
description: BBC correspondent Sean Dilley's guide dog is retiring after more than eight years of service.

title: Record number of nurses quitting the NHS
description: Experts call for urgent action to stem brain drain of staff as 40,000 walk away from health service.

title: Ukraine war: US will never recognise Russia's annexation attempts, Biden vows
description: Within hours, Vladimir Putin is expected to declare that four Ukrainian regions are joining Russia.

title: School fines: Lottery for parents with absent children
description: Families of children who miss school face harsher penalties depending on where they live in England, the BBC has found.

title: Cambodian team hunting looted treasures visits UK museums
description: The V&A and British Museum open their collections to check if they hold stolen antiquities.

title: Brazil election: Do voting machines lead to fraud?
description: President Bolsonaro says the voting machines used in Brazil are prone to fraud, but hasn't provided evidence.

title: 'The yellow Brazil shirt isn't dead - but it’s sad to see it being used'
description: As Brazil's election - and the World Cup - approach, the famous yellow shirt is being politicised.

title: King Charles: Will the monarchy move reconciliation forward in Canada?
description: The accession of King Charles could lead to greater reconciliation with indigenous people in Canada.
